Comments_List: I developed a better appreciation of the nature of logic through an investigation of the concept of logical consequence.
This course greatly improved my understanding of what logic is and how it functions. We covered a very controversial text that attempts to expose the flaws in nearly universally accepted doctrine.

I think this course was brilliant. The only thing I would change is to add some discussion of more contemporary developments in the lineage of Etchemendy and Barwise (and Shin) to show how profound the book has proven to be.
Yes, I would definitely recommend this course. I do not think enough people spend time thinking about the logic of their work and ultimately function assuming they're correct.
